page.title: 15TRADE IN LANDRAKE (PART 2)
page.content: The hairdressing salon has been established since 1984 and although only open for 3 days,is well used. The village undertaker organises burials and cremations.The Parish Cemetery is next to the Churchyard while cremations are carried out in Plymouth. Milk is delivered daily by the Hawkin family of Stoke Climsland who have built up a reputation for their reliability.A Co-op milkman also delivers door to door in the village. Down the hill to the east of the village is the local garage at Notter Bridge.This sells petrol,second hand cars and carries out MOT tests and repairs.Also at Notter Bridge is a public house of the same name.Here the customer can enjoy refreshment beside the River Lynher.
